properties.name: Landmatters Coop
properties.description: Posted by ZoewanglerOur first year of observation proved to be very worthwhile in terms of gaining local knowledge and developing as a group. Since then our main projects have been hedgelaying, planting a windbreak, starting to build a barn, and working with local groups like BTCV and Community Supported Farming. We submitted a planning application to become a mixed use permaculture project in Spring 2006. This was rejected in May 2006 and in June we were served with an enforcement order which we will appeal against. Our work with the land continues unabated.

properties.name: Low-Impact Living Initiative (LILI)
properties.description: Posted by ZoewanglerLow-Impact Living Initiative (LILI) is a non-profit organisation whose mission is to help people reduce their impact on the environment, improve their quality of life, gain new skills, live in a healthier and more satisfying way, have fun, and save money. Courses: Permaculture, herbal medicine, renewables, making shingles, water treatment, open source computing, bee-keeping, living in communities

properties.name: The Sustainability Centre
properties.description: Posted by ZoewanglerThe Centre sits in 55 acres of woodland and natural chalk downland, with several ponds and some open grassland. Our Visitor Centre holds information and displays in the foyer, has office space and also seminar rooms, catering facilities and a cafe area. The Sustainability Centre offers a range of activities including Community support Courses and Conferences for Adults Childrens events Hostel accomodation and Cafe Camping and South Downs walking Access for disabled

properties.name: Tony & Elizabeth
properties.description: Posted by ZoewanglerLooking for rural co-housing somewhere in the SE

properties.name: Torr Vale Mill, New Mill, Derbyshire
properties.description: Posted by ZoewanglerFrom English Heritage: C1790. Remarkable survival of a textile factory. Attached weir, watercourse, sluice gate were major additions between 1860 and 1879 as it moved to steam power. A Feasibility Study and Conservation Plan has been completed. 2001 fire destroyed interior and roof of building. Urgent works previously undertaken. However, condition has now deteriorated significantly. Development proposals being prepared.
